resources.string: Get started by creating IFTTT Applets using Webhooks and Orro!

To configure a room in the Spark Director app, minimal setup is required to create an IFTTT applet. An applet is the association of a trigger (using the Webhooks service) and an action (i.e. an Orro light switch, Hue smart bulb, etc.).
More information about Spark Director, compatible services, and more can be found on the Spark Director website.
Spark Director creates a centralized home for your smart lighting controls, providing a common interface no matter the brand.
Spark Director works by sending HTTP requests to specific endpoints. These requests act as triggers to a lighting action, and this is all done through IFTTT.

The Webhooks IFTTT service is used to create the enpoints and triggers. These api endpoints and key are all stored locally on the phone, not in the cloud. The endpoint/trigger is then associated with the lighting action and then you are ready to use Spark Director.
Step by step instructions can be found on the Spark Director website.
